title.native: ピーチボーイリバーサイド

description:
Saltherine Aldarake, princess of the Kingdom of Aldarake, dreams of traveling the world—a dangerous dream in a land where monsters roam the countryside as they please, and humans live behind high, strong walls. But when a chance meeting with traveler Mikoto gives hope to her dream, he shatters it soon after, as he reveals himself to be none other than Momotaro, ruthless demon-slayer. Though horrified by the gore Momotaro leaves behind, Saltherine is convinced more than ever that she needs to learn about the world beyond her walls, and journeys out...following the steps of the mysterious, charismatic, terrifying boy she met that day...

(Source: Kodansha USA)
synonyms: พีชบอยริเวอร์ไซด์

tags.name: Achronological Order
tags.description: Chapters or episodes do not occur in chronological order.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Elf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an elf.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

title.native: ピーチボーイリバーサイド
ピーチボーイリバーサイド ミニアニメ

name.native: サルトリーヌ・アルダレイク

node.description:
Circle: Ao (Not to be mistaken with Ao from Aozora Ichiba circle)

Alternate names: Ao, Blue
He is a member of Writers Guild of Japan.

[Website](http://www.jeux-deau.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/jeuxd_nakahashi)

Takaaki Nakahashi was born in Kyoto, Japan. He started playing piano from age 3 and trombone from age 12, to study the latter in France from age 18. After graduating from the Conservatoire de Saint-Etienne, he studied at the Conservatoire de Lyon. Besides being active in orchestral and chamber music, he also participated in clubs and events vigorously and also in performance and composition. After returning to Japan he started composing music for games and commercials. He has been a part-time lecturer at Takushoku University since September 2011. 

(Source: AniDB)

__Founded:__ 2015

__[Artist Profile (TOY'S FACTORY)](https://www.toysfactory.co.jp/artist/q_mhz)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/QMHz_info)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCUKcdgw725jOdQ6LfQNYZsA)__

__Introduction:__
Q-MHz is a Japanese music production team, consisting of various people from different bands.

__Members:__
- [Tomoya Tabuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/148232/Tomoya-Tabuchi), from the band [UNISON SQURE GARDEN](https://anilist.co/staff/119406/Unison-Square-Garden)
- [Tomokazu Tashiro](https://anilist.co/staff/148496)
- [Aki Hata](https://anilist.co/staff/106018), from the band Tsukihiko
- [Katsuhiko Kurosu](https://anilist.co/staff/149133), from the music production company [Peak A Soul+](https://www.peakasoul.net/)

[Website](https://yuko-suzuhana.com/) | [Twitter](https://x.com/yuchinsound)

Yuuko Suzuhana is a Japanese singer-songwriter, composer, Shigin master, and pianist, best known as the leader and vocalist of [Wagakki Band](https://anilist.co/staff/145914/Wagakki-Band). She is also involved in working as a voice actress and radio presenter.

Originating from [Studio Deen](https://anilist.co/studio/37/), where he initially worked as a composite artist.

_Note: Not to be confused with the [other director](https://anilist.co/staff/101468/) by the same name._

[Website](https://www.miteinohanashi.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/a_ru_uta__) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/aru._insta/)

Began their music activities over the internet from March 2018, where they began mostly posting cover videos under the name Aru.

After a while under the moniker Aru, they began assuming the name Mitei no Hanashi in September of 2019, when they first posted their original song named End of Reunion to the Mitei no Hanashi YouTube channel.

They first debuted in anime singing the ending theme to the anime Peach Boy Riverside in July 2021, which was then followed up by their reappearance in the anime Dragon Quest Dai no Daibouken in May 2022.
